textBeforeTable: Table 4-26 display multiple currency formats Table 4-26 provides an example that assumes you have set up the various currency formats in the report properties. 4.15.16 Example: Displaying Multiple Currency Formats in a Report displaySymbolOrNot takes one of the following values as shown in single quotes: 'true' or 'false'. When set to 'true', the currency symbol is displayed in the report based on the value for CurrencyCode. If you do not want the currency symbol to be displayed, then you can either enter 'false' or simply do not specify the parameter. At runtime, the Amount_Field is formatted according to the format you set up for the currency code in the report properties. To set the value dynamically, enter the tag name of the XML element that holds the ISO currency code. Note that an element that contains the currency code must be present in the data. CurrencyCode can either be set to a static value or it can be set dynamically. If the value is static for the report, then enter the ISO three-letter currency code in single-quotes, for example, 'USD'. Amount_Field takes the tag name of the XML element that holds the amount value in the data. where <?format-currency:Amount_Field;CurrencyCode;displaySymbolOrNot?>  The parameters for the format-currency function are as follows: 4.15.15 Applying a Currency Format to a Field
